Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Michael Laprarie
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a cheap camera, and I know you get what you pay for.  But you would be much better off to spend an extra $30 and buy a "real" digital camera with optical zoom, decent optics, a clear view screen, and full features.  This camera has none of these things.  Cheap, flimsy plastic construction, a fixed 8.5 mm lens, a tiny, blurry view screen, poor autofocus, and only the most basic of features.  It doesn't even have a time/date stamp capability.  It does not come with any memory, so you are already out another $8 - $10 to buy a 2Gb memory card for the camera.  And when you use the flash, the camera eats batteries like crazy.  I purchased this unit because I take a lot of pictures for my work.  I was looking for a lightweight digital camera inexpensive enough to be "disposable" after being subjected to extended wear and tear.  The Polariod a500 was a total failure so I ended up buying another camera -- a Kodak EasyShare C180, and I have been very pleased with it.  I gave the Polaroid a500 to my kids.  They think it's great.

Reviews.Title: I'd sooner buy a throw-away camera!
Reviews.Author: hacker
Reviews.Content: After receiving this camera I realize that usually 'you get what you pay for'. This is the flimsiest camera I have ever held. Aside from that, I took several photos and not ONE came out clearly. I couldn't possibly have returned this piece of junk any faster. Save your money!

Reviews.Title: Not a bad little camera
Reviews.Author: ydietz
Reviews.Content: I was looking in the toy cameras for a gift for my grandson and then I came across this 5 MP camera. The price was almost the same as most of the toys I looked at, which by the way were mostly 1.3 MP cameras. Big difference. So I ordered this and I'm happy that I did. Polaroid CAA-500SC 5MP CMOS Digital Camera with 1.8-Inch LCD Display (Silver)I ordered this from Click and Save and it arrived a week before the estimated delivery date.

Reviews.Title: if you're not a nit picky kinda person
Reviews.Content: that gets kicks out of finding the smallest problems and making them into large ones, then this item works just fine, i have taken pretty good pics with it, and then printed them out, and after looking them over throughly. was very satisfied with the results, the software it came with is kinda icky though, but then i really haven't used it for all but five minutes before i switching to another program, also its kinda flimsy for those with heavy hands...all in all i was looking for an affordable camera because i don't use them on a regular basis, just every now and again, so theres no need in me toting it around and risking damage to the cute camera...hope this helps those interested!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Dwayne Keith Mobley
Reviews.Content: This item provide good use to my niece, as this was her first camera, so she got hands-on-training that helped.

Reviews.Title: Worst Ever
Reviews.Author: MacAddict
Reviews.Content: I cannot express in words my extreme disappointment with this camera.  Cheap, like a toy, blurred pictures, no quality would all describe this item.  How I wish I had never wasted my money!

Reviews.Title: Great for kids
Reviews.Author: J.G.
Reviews.Content: Great for kids age of 10. and also takes nice photos. So over all happy can't seem to find a decent camera under $100 these days so this one fills the need at $55.

8MB built-in storage
Takes video Clips
